  • Field Details

    • INVALID_POSITION

      public static final int[] INVALID_POSITION
      Position returned when the calculated offsets are greater than the length of the view (e.g. contents of the view do not match the header).

  • Method Details

    • getHeaderToViewPosition

      public static int[] getHeaderToViewPosition(JTextArea view, String header, int start, int end)
      Gets the given start and end header positions offset to the given view.

      The view is expected to replace the header line endings \r\n to \n (e.g. so there's no invisible newline (\r) characters when editing), as such the positions of the header need to be offset to match the ones in the view.

      Parameters:
      view - the view that contains the contents of the header
      header - the header shown in the view
      start - the start position
      end - the end position
      Returns:
      the positions offset for the view, or INVALID_POSITION if the start, end or offset positions are greater than view's length.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the conditions is true:
      • the view is null or it has no Document;
      • the header is null;
      • the start position is negative or greater than the length of the header;
      • the end position is negative or greater than the length of the header;
      • the start position is greater than the end position.
      See Also:
      • getViewToHeaderPosition(JTextArea, int, int)
      • getBodyToViewPosition(JTextArea, String, int, int)

    • getBodyToViewPosition

      public static int[] getBodyToViewPosition(JTextArea view, String header, int start, int end)
      Gets the given start and end body positions offset to the given view.

      The view is expected to replace the header line endings \r\n to \n (e.g. so there's no invisible newline (\r) characters when editing), as such the positions of the body (shown after the header) need to be offset to match the ones in the view.

      Parameters:
      view - the view that contains the contents of the header and the body
      header - the header shown in the view
      start - the start position
      end - the end position
      Returns:
      the positions offset for the view, or INVALID_POSITION if the start and end positions are greater than the length of the body or the view.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the conditions is true:
      • the view is null or it has no Document;
      • the header is null;
      • the start position is negative;
      • the end position is negative;
      • the start position is greater than the end position.
      See Also:
      • getHeaderToViewPosition(JTextArea, String, int, int)
      • getViewToHeaderBodyPosition(JTextArea, String, int, int)

    • getViewToHeaderPosition

      public static int[] getViewToHeaderPosition(JTextArea view, int start, int end)
      Gets the given start and end view positions offset to a header.

      The view is expected to replace the header line endings \r\n to \n (e.g. so there's no invisible newline (\r) characters when editing), as such the positions of the view need to be offset to match the ones in the header.

      Parameters:
      view - the view that contains the contents of a header
      start - the start position
      end - the end position
      Returns:
      the positions offset for the header, or INVALID_POSITION if the start or end is greater than the length of the view
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the conditions is true:
      • the view is null or it has no Document;
      • the start position is negative;
      • the end position is negative;
      • the start position is greater than the end position.
      See Also:
      • getHeaderToViewPosition(JTextArea, String, int, int)
      • getViewToHeaderBodyPosition(JTextArea, String, int, int)

    • getViewToHeaderBodyPosition

      public static int[] getViewToHeaderBodyPosition(JTextArea view, String header, int start, int end)
      Gets the given start and end view positions offset to, or after, the given header.

      The view is expected to replace the header line endings \r\n to \n (e.g. so there's no invisible newline (\r) characters when editing), as such the positions of the view need to be offset to match the ones in, or after, the header.

      Parameters:
      view - the view that contains the contents of the header and body
      header - the header shown in the view
      start - the start position
      end - the end position
      Returns:
      the positions offset for the header or, 3 positions, for after the body (the third position is just to indicate that it's the body, the value is meaningless), or INVALID_POSITION if the start or end is greater than the length of the view
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any of the conditions is true:
      • the view is null or it has no Document;
      • the start position is negative;
      • the end position is negative;
      • the start position is greater than the end position.
